dublin_core.dcvalue: Potential health effects of cell phone use in children have not been adequately examined As children are using cell phones at earlier ages research among this group has been identified as the highest priority by both national and international organisations The authors previously reported results from the Danish National Birth Cohort DNBC which looked at prenatal and postnatal exposure to cell phone use and behavioural problems at age 7 years Exposure to cell phones prenatally and to a lesser degree postnatally was associated with more behavioural difficulties The original analysis included nearly 13 000 children who reached age 7 years by November 2006
Journal of epidemiology and community health
Cell phone use and behavioural problems in young children.
